title: As Commuters Line Up Rides, Some Hope to Ride Out Scare

body: This list summarizes our recommendations in some of today's primary election races throughout New York State. In some cases the primary is tantamount to election. In others, we may endorse again for the Nov. 5 general election. Polling hours in the metropolitan area are from 6 a.m. to 9 p.m. GOVERNOR H. Carl McCall (D) LIEUTENANT GOVERNOR Dennis
title: New York Primary Choices

body: Of the 18 Civil Court judgeships up for election in New York City this November, only six are being contested in next week's Democratic primary. As a practical matter, that means the remaining dozen seats will be filled by men and women deeply beholden to the party pols who gave them a berth on the Democratic line and a virtually uncontested ride
title: For Civil Court in Brooklyn

body: There is something unsinkably optimistic about a steel-drum band that keeps on drumming even though its instruments are filling up with rain. In similar fashion, the heart warms to find Caribbean women dancing in sequined bikinis covered with plastic garbage bags. The West Indian American Day Carnival Parade came to Brooklyn yesterday for the 35th
title: Rain Fails to Silence Revelry At a Joyful West Indian Parade

body: SPIKE LEE has relocated to the Upper East Side and Spike's Joint, his boutique at the corner of South Elliot Place and Lafayette Avenue, is history, but the filmmaker's lens still frames the image of Fort Greene, the Brooklyn neighborhood where he grew up. When he began his career with the 1986 comedy ''She's Gotta Have It,'' he drew upon the world
title: If You're Thinking of Living In/Fort Greene; Diversity, Culture and Brownstones, Too

body: Here are our endorsements in Democratic primary elections for the New York State Assembly in Queens, Brooklyn, the Bronx and Westchester County. 22nd District, Queens (Flushing): In this predominantly Asian district there are four major candidates: John Albert, Jimmy Meng, Barry Grodenchik and Ethel Chen. Ms. Chen offers the most independent
title: Endorsements for Assembly Primaries

body: Alan G. Hevesi stood before the congregation at the Unity Fellowship Church of Christ in the Clinton Hill section of Brooklyn last Sunday and spoke as much about the man he supports for governor as he did about his own race for New York State comptroller. It was Mr. Hevesi's third campaign stop of the day in a weekend filled with appearances
title: While Praising McCall, Hevesi Intensifies Efforts in Race for State Comptroller

body: If New York City has learned anything about Joel I. Klein, the new schools chancellor, since his appointment on July 29, it is that he is conspicuously discreet. Mr. Klein, who this week is wrapping up his work as the chairman and chief executive of Bertelsmann Inc., has not granted any interviews or announced any staff appointments or plans for
title: Schools Chief Is Soaking Up Advice in San Diego

body: The boys from Lafayette Gardens went sledding yesterday. While it was a cool day, it was hardly cold enough for snow, so they used another medium: the concrete steps at the obelisk at Fort Greene Park in Brooklyn. Tony Vails, 14, seeming to relish a breezy day that ended an eight-day heat wave in the city, explained how it worked. ''First, you get
title: The Temperature Falls And a City's Spirit Soars

Jeffries can be found at the entrance to one subway station or another in Brooklyn, handing out campaign literature and passionately explaining to anyone who will listen to what he considers the deficiencies of Assemblyman Roger L. Green, a 22-year incumbent whom Mr. Jeffries hopes to unseat. If Mr. Jeffries's
title: Rematch Produces Spirited Primary Race for Assembly Seat in Brooklyn

body: A day after he escaped from a police van in Brooklyn and fled in handcuffs into a subway station, a 19-year-old man arrested Friday on misdemeanor marijuana charges remained at large yesterday, the police said. The escaped prisoner, Jaime Ramirez, of Saratoga Avenue, Brooklyn, is at least the 15th person to have escaped police custody this year.
title: Metro Briefing | New York: Brooklyn: Search For Escaped Prisoner

title: In Brooklyn, An 'Insurgent' Vs. a Stalwart

body: To the Editor: Your April 14 article ''A Broken Angel Lifts Its Eccentric Wings Over the Brooklyn Skyline'' contains several statements and allegations to which I would like to respond. Broken Angel, my building at 4 Downing Street, is not 10 stories high. It is four stories with a 1.5-story penthouse. It is not ''a jumble of structures cobbled
title: Broken Angel's Creator Explains His Methods

body: AS the weather warms and days grow longer, curious people fan out to visit show houses and to tour private houses, apartments and gardens in search of design ideas and inspiration. Here are some of the events in the Northeast. Unless otherwise noted, tours are self-guided. New York FLATBUSH, BROOKLYN, APRIL 28: Ten houses in the Queen Anne,
title: The Tours of Spring, Beckoning Like Daffodils

body: Brooklyn's skyline has only a few standouts. A building named Broken Angel is one of them. The building, at 4 Downing Street, north of Fulton Street in Clinton Hill, is 10 stories high behind a tract of starter homes on Grand Avenue. It is a jumble of structures cobbled together seemingly without reason; some of its ''stories'' are no more than
title: NEIGHBORHOOD REPORT: CLINTON HILL; A Broken Angel Lifts Its Eccentric Wings Over the Brooklyn Skyline

body: WITH Manhattan's co-op and condominium market returning to a rolling boil, a number of real estate brokers and executives say the city is rife with -- can you believe it? -- bad behavior among agents, which they say hurts the buyers and sellers alike. Disgruntled brokers say increasingly competitive colleagues are withholding, or pocketing, their
title: TURF; Agents Play Hide-and-Seek As the Market Quickens

body: A murder suspect who escaped from a Brooklyn police station house 10 days ago was captured yesterday in Brooklyn, the police said. The man, Alexis Vasquez, 22, who was a suspect in a double homicide in December and a double shooting in March, escaped after he was left alone without handcuffs on the second floor of the 88th Precinct station house,
title: Police Capture Escaped Suspect

body: An article on Saturday about a suspect in a double homicide who the police say escaped from the 88th Precinct station house in Brooklyn on Friday misstated its location. The station is in the Clinton Hill section, not Fort Greene.
title: Corrections

body: A man who was arrested Thursday, a suspect in a a double homicide in December and a double shooting this month, escaped from a Brooklyn station house last night, the police said. The man, Alexis Vasquez, 22, was left alone without handcuffs on the second floor of the 88th Precinct station house in Fort Greene when he pulled away a locked window
title: Murder Suspect Escapes From Station House

body: Hide of Cloth, Heart of Gold No theme seems to recur more often in children's books and entertainment than that of a toy coming to life. One of the most tender belongs to the Velveteen Rabbit, the title
title: FAMILY FARE
